intro: Tarenna pallidula, commonly known as the pale tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often found along the stems. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Tarenna pallidula is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy.
